data.name: Sculpting and Rendering a Cthulhu Bust
data.detailed_description:
Steam Video

This content is only available in an online streaming format. More information about streaming videos can be found in the https://support.steampowered.com/kb_article.php?ref=8699-OASD-1871">Streaming Videos on Steam FAQ.


About the Video

In this tutorial, we'll create a Cthulhu bust in ZBrush starting from a sphere. We'll use features like Dynamesh, Curve Brush and Transpose Master. I'll show you every step of the process from designing in 3D, blocking out forms to adding realistic micro-detail. Learn how to use Keyshot to light, shade and render your Cthulhu bust. Then using Photoshop, we'll composite our renders and add finishing touches to create the final render. This is a live video demonstration covering every step of the process.

This tutorial is catered towards ZBrush beginners. However, a basic knowledge of Zbrush is required. Average knowledge of Photoshop & Keyshot required.

Latest ZBrush UI configs available at http://www.dominicqwek.com/tutorials

Chapters

  • Sculpting with ZBrush
  • Rendering with Keyshot and Photoshop

Files:

  • ZBrush UI config + Gravity Brush
  • Decimated ZTL file for reference.
  • Cthulhu OBJ files for Keyshot
  • Working PSD file
  • Final JPEG artwork
  • 1 Hi-Res skin texture

I'll show you every step of the process from designing in 3D, blocking out forms to adding realistic micro-detail. Learn how to use Keyshot to light, shade and render your Cthulhu bust.

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Windows 7
  • Processor: Intel Core 2 or AMD equivalent
  • Memory: 1 GB RAM
  • Network: Broadband Internet connection
  • Storage: 200 MB available space
  • Additional Notes: Network Bandwidth of 5Mbps for 540p, 3Mbps for 360p.
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • OS: Windows 10
  • Processor: Intel Core I3+ or AMD equivalent recommended for HD 1080p playback
  • Memory: 2 GB RAM
  • Network: Broadband Internet connection
  • Storage: 500 MB available space
  • Additional Notes: Network Bandwidth of 12Mbps for 1080p or 8Mbps for 720p.
